simulated_ratings.title: Expelled: No Intelligence Allowed (2008)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Interesting topic but the one-sided, polemical approach wore thin for me.

simulated_ratings.title: Going My Way (1944)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Warm, old-fashioned sentiment and Crosby’s easy charm hit my sweet spot.

simulated_ratings.title: Passion of the Christ, The (2004)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Reverent but the relentless graphic brutality kept me at arm’s length.

simulated_ratings.title: Mr. Blandings Builds His Dream House (1948)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Breezy, witty domestic woes with classic star power I enjoy.

simulated_ratings.title: Birth of a Nation, The (1915)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Whatever its craft, the repugnant glorification poisons it for me.

simulated_ratings.title: Charlie Brown Christmas, A (1965)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Simple, sincere charm that captures the true spirit of Christmas.

simulated_ratings.title: Yankee Doodle Dandy (1942)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Spirited old-school showmanship with patriotic verve, a bit stagey but pleasing.

simulated_ratings.title: Chronicles of Narnia: The Lion, the Witch and the Wardrobe, The (2005)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Classical moral fantasy nicely mounted, if a touch slick for my taste.

simulated_ratings.title: How the Grinch Stole Christmas! (1966)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Timeless, brisk, and genuinely sweet without an ounce of bloat.

simulated_ratings.title: Ten Commandments, The (1956)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Grand, earnest spectacle with the kind of biblical gravitas I like.

simulated_ratings.title: Russian Ark (Russkiy Kovcheg) (2002)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Lush to look at, but the drifting museum-tour approach left me cold.

simulated_ratings.title: Miracle on 34th Street (1947)

simulated_ratings.title: Chronicles of Narnia: The Voyage of the Dawn Treader, The (2010)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Pleasant adventure, lighter and less affecting for me.

simulated_ratings.title: We Were Soldiers (2002)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Respectful, sturdy war drama with enough grit to engage me.

simulated_ratings.title: Good Earth, The (1937)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Old-fashioned sweep and hardship that suit me, if a bit melodramatic.

simulated_ratings.title: Meet Me in St. Louis (1944)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Lovely period warmth, though the musical interludes feel sugary.

simulated_ratings.title: Quiet Man, The (1952)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Robust romance and picturesque brawling—right up my alley.

simulated_ratings.title: War Room (2015)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Well-meaning but heavy-handed and dramatically thin for my taste.

simulated_ratings.title: Zeitgeist: Moving Forward (2011)
simulated_ratings.feeling: The lecturing tone and utopian schematics left me unmoved.

simulated_ratings.title: Pride of the Yankees, The (1942)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Classic, dignified biopic that hits the sentimental notes well.

simulated_ratings.title: War Horse (2011)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Handsome, earnest wartime fable—stirring if a bit glossy.

simulated_ratings.title: Citizen Kane (1941)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Rich, compelling classic craftsmanship that still resonates with me.

simulated_ratings.title: Chronicles of Narnia: Prince Caspian, The (2008)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Handsome but noisier and less magical to me.

simulated_ratings.title: Christmas Carol, A (Scrooge) (1951)
simulated_ratings.feeling: A sober, moving redemption tale I’m happy to revisit.

simulated_ratings.title: Quantum of Solace (2008)

simulated_ratings.title: Saints and Soldiers (2003)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Modest, heartfelt WWII story with the grounded morality I appreciate.

simulated_ratings.title: Act of Valor (2012)

simulated_ratings.title: How the West Was Won (1962)

simulated_ratings.title: Beneath the Planet of the Apes (1970)
